qas.question: When was the Release Preview revealed to consumers?

What were the main components of the Release preview?

answers.text: addition of Sports, Travel, and News apps, along with an integrated version of Adobe Flash Player

plausible_answers.text: addition of Sports, Travel, and News apps, along with an integrated version of Adobe Flash Player

What was the build number of the Windows 9 Release Preview?
When was the Windows 9 Release Preview accidentally revealed?

context: Many other builds were released until the Japan's Developers Day conference, when Steven Sinofsky announced that Windows 8 Release Preview (build <a3_0>8400<a3_0/>) would be released during the first week of June. On <a4_0><b9_0>May 28, 2012<b9_0/><a4_0/>, Windows 8 Release Preview (Standard Simplified Chinese x64 edition, not China-specific version, build <b8_0>8400<b8_0/>) was leaked online on various Chinese and BitTorrent websites. On <a0_0><b5_0>May 31, 2012<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Windows 8 Release Preview was released to the public by Microsoft. Major items in the Release Preview included the <a2_0><b7_0>addition of Sports, Travel, and News apps, along with an integrated version of Adobe Flash Player<b7_0/><a2_0/> in Internet Explorer. Like the Developer Preview and the Consumer Preview, the release preview expired on <a1_0><b6_0>January 15, 2013<b6_0/><a1_0/>.
